item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok says it is restoring service for U.S. users (264 points | 674 comments)
2. Using your Apple device as an access card in unsupported systems (87 points | 20 comments)
3. Why is Git Autocorrect too fast for Formula One drivers? (22 points | 9 comments)
4. The surprising struggle to get a Unix Epoch time from a UTC string in C or C++ (46 points | 17 comments)
5. Robotics and ROS 2 Essentials (56 points | 28 comments)
6. Ancient Phoenician Shipwreck Recovered, Sank 2.6k Years Ago Off Coast of Spain (25 points | discuss)
7. The Fuzzing Book (94 points | 4 comments)
8. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (210 points | 15 comments)
9. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (65 points | 27 comments)
10. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (294 points | 215 comments)
11. GauntletAI (YC S17) will fly you out, train you to build w AI, give you 200k job ( | hide)
12. Build a tiny CA for your homelab with a Raspberry Pi (28 points | 7 comments)
13. Strontium isoscape of sub-Saharan Africa allows tracing slave trade (2024) (20 points | 8 comments)
14. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (191 points | 135 comments)
15. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (125 points | 45 comments)
16. Philosophy Eats AI (10 points | 2 comments)
17. “The Traitors”, a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (96 points | 88 comments)
18. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (263 points | 147 comments)
19. IsMyXFeedFucked – Analyze How Your X Feed's Impacting You (59 points | 87 comments)
20. VS Code Pets (481 points | 124 comments)
21. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (47 points | 6 comments)
22. Calculator Forensics (2002) (14 points | discuss)
23. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (86 points | 26 comments)
24. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (204 points | 37 comments)
25. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (137 points | 197 comments)
26. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (132 points | 88 comments)
27. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (101 points | 14 comments)
28. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (142 points | 63 comments)
29. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (495 points | 189 comments)
30. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (223 points | 107 comments)
